DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Surgery Radiation Therapy Cure Eligibility Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to cancer being curative through radiation therapy (use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively) and/or surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Surgery Radiation Therapy Cure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to cancer being curative through radiation therapy (use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively) and/or surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient's cancer amena
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's cancer amenable to curative treatment with surgery or radiation therapy

ReferenceDocuments.description: Are all metastases to be treated amenable to SBRT?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Are all metastases not resected amenable to SBRT?

ReferenceDocuments.description: All known disease amenable to metastasis-directed therapy with either SBRT or resection?
